snippet: The engineering company KBR agreed to pay the agency $130,000 for forcing employees to sign documents that could stifle possible whistle-blowers.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission announces KBR will pay $130,000 fine for forcing employees to sign confidentiality agreements that stifle potential whistle-blowers; it is first action against a company agency has taken in its push to escalate enforcement of whistle-blower protections.
lead_paragraph: The engineering company KBR agreed to pay the agency $130,000 for forcing employees to sign documents that could stifle possible whistle-blowers.

headline.main: S.E.C. Fires Warning Shot About Confidentiality Agreements
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Fires a Warning Shot About Employee Confidentiality Agreements
